ARABIC: وَإِن نَّشَأْ نُغْرِقْهُمْ فَلَا صَرِيخَ لَهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنقَذُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: If We wished, We could drown them with no one to hear their cry, and then they would not be saved -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We could have drowned them if We pleased, and none would have answered their cry for help, nor would they have been saved,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Should We so wish, We can drown them, and there will be none to heed their cries of distress, nor will they be rescued.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Had We wanted, We could have drowned them and nothing would have been able to help or rescue them
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And if We will, We can drown them, so there would be no help in their distress, nor would they be saved.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And if We will, We shall drown them, and there will be no shout for them, nor will they be saved.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And if We please, We can drown them, then there shall be no succorer for them, nor shall they be rescued
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and if We will, We drown them, then none have they to cry to, neither are they delivered,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And if We will, We drown them, and there is no help for them, neither can they be saved;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: If it were Our will, We could drown them: then there would be no helper [to hear their cry], nor could they be saved.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And if We list, We shall drown them, and there will be no shout for them, nor will they be saved.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And if We like We drown them, whereat they have no one to call for help, nor are they rescued
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: If it were Our Will, We could drown them: then would there be no helper (to hear their cry), nor could they be delivered,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And if We will, We shall drown them, and there will be no shout (or helper) for them (to hear their cry for help) nor will they be saved.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We drown them if We will, then they have none to cry to, nor can they be saved,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: If We will, We can drown them—with no screaming to be heard from them, nor will they be saved.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And if We should will, We could drown them; then no one responding to a cry would there be for them, nor would they be saved
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [36:43] And if We will, We drown them, despite the existence of ships [for them to ride safely in], whereat they have no one to call to, [none] to succour [them], nor are they rescued, delivered —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And if We will, We drown them) in the sea, (and there is no help for them) from drowning, (neither can they be saved) from drowning;
